questions.question: A DFA is called deterministic because:

answers.a: It allows multiple transitions for the same input symbol
answers.b: It has exactly one transition for each input symbol from every state

questions.question: Which of the following automata has exactly one initial state?
In a DFA, a final state is:

answers.b: A state with no outgoing transitions
answers.c: A state where the input string is accepted

questions.question: A language is regular if it can be represented by:
What is the purpose of a transition function in a DFA?

answers.b: To define the set of final states
answers.c: To determine the next state based on current state and input symbol

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true regarding the equivalence of DFAs and NFAs?

answers.a: Every DFA has an equivalent NFA, but not every NFA has an equivalent DFA
answers.b: Every NFA has an equivalent DFA, but the DFA may have exponentially more states
answers.c: DFAs and NFAs recognize different sets of languages
answers.d: NFAs can recognize some languages that DFAs cannot

questions.question: When converting an NFA to a DFA, the resulting DFA:

answers.a: Always has the same number of states
answers.b: May have more states, at most equal to 2^n where n is the number of NFA states
answers.c: Requires less memory for state representation

questions.question: Why are DFAs considered equivalent in power to NFAs?

answers.a: Because DFAs are faster than NFAs
answers.b: Because every NFA can be transformed into a DFA that recognizes the same language
answers.c: Because NFAs can only recognize a subset of the languages recognized by DFAs

questions.question: Which of the following is a common consequence of converting an NFA to its equivalent DFA?

answers.a: The DFA has fewer states than the NFA
answers.b: The DFA runs slower than the NFA
answers.c: The DFA may have exponentially more states than the NFA
answers.d: The DFA allows epsilon transitions, unlike the NFA

questions.question: In terms of language recognition, what is true for both DFAs and NFAs?

answers.a: They can recognize all regular and some non-regular languages
answers.b: They can only recognize context-free languages
answers.c: They recognize exactly the same set of regular languages
answers.d: They are equivalent to context-sensitive grammars

questions.question: The subset construction method is used to:

answers.a: Minimize the number of states in a DFA
answers.b: Convert a regular expression to a DFA
answers.c: Convert an NFA to an equivalent DFA
answers.d: Create an NFA from a context-free grammar

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the relationship between DFAs and NFAs regarding computational power?

answers.a: NFAs are computationally more powerful than DFAs
answers.b: DFAs and NFAs are equally powerful but may differ in efficiency
answers.c: DFAs are more efficient but less powerful than NFAs
answers.d: NFAs can simulate a Turing machine, but DFAs cannot

questions.question: Which operation is typically used when constructing a DFA from an NFA to handle multiple possible states?
